definition: to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
see 李适[Li3 Kuo4]
surname Shi
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to stop/to prohibit/until/only

sentences.english: Remember to stop, do not let me pierce the paper goes on already full of loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 记得适可而止，别让我捅破那张早已漏洞百出的纸。

sentences.english: Not to pay, to know not overdo sth.
sentences.chinese: 㪷翡得不到的付出，要懂得适可而止。

sentences.english: And this means nothing other than that starting from there I cannot go (7) any further.
sentences.chinese: 这道道地地意味着，从这里开始，我该适可而止了。

sentences.english: I don't mind loud music once in a while, but enough is enough.
sentences.chinese: 我偶尔还可以忍受吵杂的音乐，但是请适可而止。

sentences.english: Is lying acceptable if you are committed to stopping when you can?
sentences.chinese: 如果能够做到适可而止，那么谎言能够被接受吗？

sentences.english: It also means maintaining a reasonable approach to things like alcohol and caffeine.
sentences.chinese: 这也意味着对于像酒精和咖啡因的东西要适可而止。

sentences.english: It's time to say enough is enough.
sentences.chinese: 是时候说应该适可而止了。

definition: too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
propriety/appropriate behavior/proper speech or action/within the norms
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
to understand/to know/to comprehend
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
don't!/must not
to assess one's capabilities and act accordingly (idiom); to act within one's competence/One does what one can.
excessive/undue/overly
to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)
to play with fire and get burnt (idiom); fig. to play with evil and suffer the consequences/to get one's fingers burnt
to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
everything
blindly/invariably
